parts.text:
{
  "translation": "(1) This is a decoration with gohei (paper streamers), used when offering sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as a representative of humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).",
  "title": "Footnote Translation",
  "comment": "Translated the Japanese footnote about kike-ush-pashui and iku pashui, explaining their usage in offering sake to gods and during feasts.",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_JA_to_EN",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_ja_to_en.translation: (1) This is a decoration with gohei (paper streamers), used when offering sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as a representative of humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).
translation_result_ja_to_en.title: Footnote Translation
translation_result_ja_to_en.comment: Translated the Japanese footnote about kike-ush-pashui and iku pashui, explaining their usage in offering sake to gods and during feasts.

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "（1）指用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神明敬獻神酒。這種kike-ush-pashui 擔任人類的代理，將人類想對神明說的話傳達給神明。未裝飾御幣的普通筷子稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。",
  "title": "",
  "comment": "Translated from Japanese to Traditional Chinese.",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_JA_to_ZH",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_ja_to_zh.translation: （1）指用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神明敬獻神酒。這種kike-ush-pashui 擔任人類的代理，將人類想對神明說的話傳達給神明。未裝飾御幣的普通筷子稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。
translation_result_ja_to_zh.comment: Translated from Japanese to Traditional Chinese.

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "（1）這是一種用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神靈供奉神酒。這個kike-ush-pashui作為人類的代表，將人類想對神靈說的話傳達給神靈。沒有裝飾御幣的普通筷子被稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。",
  "title": "腳註翻譯",
  "comment": "翻譯了關於kike-ush-pashui和iku pashui的日文腳註，解釋了它們在向神靈供奉神酒和宴會期間的用法。",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_EN_to_ZH",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_en_to_zh.translation: （1）這是一種用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神靈供奉神酒。這個kike-ush-pashui作為人類的代表，將人類想對神靈說的話傳達給神靈。沒有裝飾御幣的普通筷子被稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。
translation_result_en_to_zh.title: 腳註翻譯
translation_result_en_to_zh.comment: 翻譯了關於kike-ush-pashui和iku pashui的日文腳註，解釋了它們在向神靈供奉神酒和宴會期間的用法。

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "(1) This refers to items decorated with gohei (paper streamers), which are used when offering sacred sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as an agent for humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).",
  "title": "",
  "comment": "Translated from Japanese.",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_ZH_to_EN",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_zh_to_en.translation: (1) This refers to items decorated with gohei (paper streamers), which are used when offering sacred sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as an agent for humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).
